page.title: List of UEFA club competition winners

revisions.rev:
[[File:Las copas de europa!.jpg|thumb|right|250px|The nine [[European Champion Clubs' Cup]]s won by [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] are on display in the team's museum.]] The [[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]] (UEFA) is the administrative and controlling body for European [[association football]]. It runs three club competitions: the [[UEFA Champions League]], [[UEFA Europa League]] and [[UEFA Super Cup]]. UEFA was also responsible for the running of the [[UEFA Cup Winners' Cup]], which was discontinued in 1999, for the [[UEFA Intertoto Cup]], discontinued in 2008 and for the [[Intercontinental Cup (football)|Intercontinental Cup]], discotinued in 2004. The only team to have won all [[List_of_UEFA_club_competition_winners#Key|UEFA club competitions]] is [[Italy|Italian]] club [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]]. They received ''[[The UEFA Plaque]]'' from the Europe's football government body on 12 July 1988 in recognition of winning the three major [[UEFA club competition records|European club competitions]] (European Cup/Champions League, Cup Winner's Cup and UEFA Cup/Europa League).{{cite news|language=Spanish|url=http://hemeroteca.lavanguardia.es/preview/1988/07/13/pagina-53/33040569/pdf.html|title=Sorteo de las competiciones europeas de fÃºtbol: el Fram de Reykjavic, primer adversario del F.C. Barcelona en la Recopa|publisher=[[La Vanguardia]]|format=PDF|page=53|date=1988-07-13|accessdate=2009-11-15}} Juventus eventually won the Intertoto Cup in 1999.{{cite web|url=http://archiviostorico.gazzetta.it/1997/maggio/24/Tutto_inizio_con_poesia_ga_0_9705246555.shtml |title=All start 'with a little' poetry |work=Gazzetta dello Sport's Historical Archive |accessdate=1997-05-24 |language=Italian }} Juventus' fellow Italian club, [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], is the most successful club, winning 17 competitions, while [[Spain|Spanish]] club [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], which holds the record for the most UEFA Champions League victories, is the second most successful, with 15 titles and [[F.C. Barcelona|Barcelona]] is third, winning 12 competitions. Italian clubs are the most successful, having won 48 titles and Spanish clubs are tied for second for most successful with 44 titles. While the [[Inter-Cities Fairs Cup]] is considered to be the predecessor to the UEFA Cup, UEFA does not consider the tournament to be an official UEFA contest, and therefore successes in this competition are not included in the list.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefa/news/kind=1/newsid=2571.html|title=UEFA Cup: All-time finals |date=2005-06-30|accessdate=2008-03-15|publisher=[[UEFA]] |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080309094213/http://www.uefa.com/uefa/news/kind=1/newsid=2571.html |archivedate = 2008-03-09}} Also excluded are the [[1972 UEFA Super Cup]] title, which is also considered unofficial by [[UEFA]],{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/competitions/supercup/format/index.html |accessdate=2008-03-20 |publisher=[[UEFA]] |title=UEFA Super Cup - Format }} and the [[FIFA Club World Cup]], a [[FIFA#FIFA structured tournaments|FIFA club competition]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fifa.com/mm/document/fifafacts/mencompovw/51/98/99/fs-299_04a_comp-host-ov.pdf|title=FIFA competition overview 1908-2012|format=PDF|page=4|accessdate=2009-12-22|publisher=[[FIFA]]}} ==Key== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;" |- |CL |[[UEFA Champions League|European Champion Clubs' Cup or UEFA Champions League]] |- |CWC |[[UEFA Cup Winners' Cup]] |- |UEL |[[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup or UEFA Europa League]] |- |UIC |[[UEFA Intertoto Cup]] |- |SC |[[UEFA Super Cup]] |- |IC |[[Intercontinental Cup (football)|Intercontinental Cup]] |} ==By club== This table lists the total number of UEFA club competitions won by clubs. [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] have won the most UEFA club competitions winning 17. They hold the record for the most [[UEFA Super Cup]] victories, winning the competition five times.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/competitions/supercup/format/newsid=316985.html|title=Competition format|accessdate=2008-03-13|date=2007-06-01|publisher=[[UEFA]]}} [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] are the second most successful club in UEFA competitions winning 15. Out of these 15, a record nine were won in the [[UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League and its predecessor]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/competitions/ucl/finals/newsid=421025.html |accessdate=2008-03-04|title=Final facts and figures |publisher=[[UEFA]]}} [[F.C. Barcelona|Barcelona]] is third in the list, having won 12 UEFA competitions. Barcelona has won the [[UEFA Cup Winner's Cup]] four times which is the record. [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[F.C. Internazionale Milano|Internazionale]] have each won the [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup or Europa League]] a record three times.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/competitions/uefacup/format/index.html |title=Competition format |publisher=[[UEFA]] |date=2005-07-13 |accessdate=2008-07-09 }} To date, only [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] and [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] have won all three main UEFA club competitions (European Champions Clubs' Cup or [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], [[UEFA Cup Winners' Cup|Cup Winners' Cup]] and UEFA Cup or [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]]). Braga|Braga]] |{{flag|Portugal}} |align=center| 0 |align=center| 0 |align=center| 0 |align=center| 1 |align=center| 0 |align=center| 0 |align=center| '''1''' |- !scope="row"|[[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] |{{flag|Ukraine}} |align=center| 0 |align=center| 0 |align=center| 1 |align=center| 0 |align=center| 0 |align=center| 0 |align=center| '''1''' |} ==By country== This table lists the total number of titles won by clubs from each country. Italian clubs are the most successful in [[UEFA]] competitions, having won 48 titles. Italian clubs have won the [[UEFA Champions League]] 12 times, who they share with Spanish clubs for first place. Clubs from [[Italy]] have also won the most [[UEFA Europa League]] Cups, [[UEFA Super Cup]]s and [[Intercontinental Cup (football)|Intercontinental Cups]]. Spanish clubs are second, with 44 titles. English clubs have won 37 [[UEFA]] titles.
